fr.insa.rennes.info.chemical.backend

Class ChemicalThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • fr.insa.rennes.info.chemical.backend.ChemicalThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class ChemicalThread
extends java.lang.Thread
    This class executes a reaction, it uses a reaction rule object and its ReactionRule.computeSelect() and ReactionRule.computeResult() functions to process to reactions. Each reaction rule in a solution is given a chemical thread that will execute its reaction according to its specifications (reactives, products, ...).
    Author:
    Andréolli Cédric, Boulanger Chloé, Cléro Olivier, Guellier Antoine, Guilloux Sébastien, Templé Arthur

        public ChemicalThread(ReactionRule r,
              Solution s,
              java.lang.ThreadGroup g)
        Builds a ChemicalThread object.
        Parameters:
        r - The ReactionRule to be processed by this thread
        s - The solution in which the reaction rule acts
        g - The ThreadGroup of this Thread (for super constructor)

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        The main function of the thread, that loops until the solution is inert or until the thread is manually stopped with stopTheThread(). The loop begins by calling Solution.requestForParameters(ReactionRule). If the function succeeds, the result of the reaction is computed (ReactionRule.computeResult()) and the products of the reaction is re-inserted in the solution. Finally, it wakes all the chemical threads in the solution. If the reaction rule is one-shot, this thread stops and the reaction rule object is deleted from the solution. In case where Solution.requestForParameters(ReactionRule) fails, Solution.makeSleep() is called in order to wait until new reactives are added to the solution or until the solution becomes inert.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread
        See Also:
        ReactionRule.Multiplicity

      • stopTheThread

        public void stopTheThread()
        Stops the infinite loop in the run() function.
